meanings.sent1: The soup had a cabbagy flavor that reminded me of my grandma's cooking.
meanings.sent2: The cabbagy aroma from the kitchen made my stomach growl.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally bought a cabbagy-scented candle instead of a fruity one.
meanings.sent4: The cabbagy color of the walls in the kitchen gave it a cozy feel.
meanings.sent5: The cabbagy texture of the fabric felt rough against my skin.

meanings.definition: Having a taste or smell similar to cabbage.
meanings.sent1: The stir-fry had a cabbagy taste that made it delicious.
meanings.sent2: The cabbagy smell of the stew filled the house with warmth.
meanings.sent3: She wrinkled her nose at the cabbagy scent coming from the fridge.
meanings.sent4: The air in the kitchen was thick with the cabbagy aroma of boiled cabbage.
meanings.sent5: The cabbagy flavor of the coleslaw was refreshing on a hot day.
